since_last_update: Dominant cross-asset change: violent precious-metals deleveraging moved from a commodity story into broader risk sentiment, with margin mechanics explicitly cited (CME margin hikes) and forced unwinds/margin calls flagged as the transmission channel into equities/crypto (Reuters).

Policy-path risk re-entered as a first-order driver: Trump’s reported nomination of Kevin Warsh to succeed Powell raised uncertainty about the future Fed reaction function/independence, contributing to rate/FX/commodity volatility and duration-equity sensitivity (Reuters, AP, MarketWatch).

Energy tail risk briefly eased at the margin: headlines/remarks implying Iran talks reduced immediate supply-disruption fear, weighing on oil and removing an inflation-hedge bid that had supported parts of the complex (AP, Washington Post).

Europe data was modestly less-bad: Germany final manufacturing PMI revised up (still <50) and UK final manufacturing PMI slightly higher; marginally supportive for EU/UK risk tone but second-order for US futures vs US rates/data (LOCAL).

New sector-specific headline: reported $12B US strategic minerals stockpile plan lifted critical-minerals/rare-earths risk premia and could rotate flows within equities (materials/defense/industrial supply chain), but unlikely to be the main index driver unless it triggers China response (Bloomberg via Investing.com).
today_focus: Primary driver check (most consistent across sources): precious-metals rout + deleveraging/forced liquidation spilling into broader risk assets; watch whether selling pressure broadens via VAR/prime-broker constraints and whether miners/commodity-linked credit becomes the stress point (Reuters, MarketWatch).

Secondary driver: Fed leadership/policy-path uncertainty (Warsh nomination narrative) as a volatility amplifier—most likely expressed via real rates, USD, and equity-duration factor rotation (NQ sensitivity > ES) (Reuters, AP).

Key near-term catalyst for rates-risk: today’s ISM Manufacturing and ISM Prices components—market likely to read any upside in prices as “sticky inflation/real-yields up” (risk-negative for duration equities and gold), while activity weakness is “growth scare” (risk-negative but rates can rally) (calendar; mechanism inference).

Gold focus: direction likely dominated by (1) forced selling/position unwind and margin dynamics near-term, versus (2) medium-term macro hedging demand tied to Fed independence/political risk; expect higher intraday elasticity to USD/real yields than usual (Reuters, AP; mechanism inference).

Watch for narrative pivot: if precious-metals stabilization occurs, index focus may revert quickly to earnings concentration and US data cadence; if not, deleveraging remains the umbrella driver (Reuters, MarketWatch).

market_pricing.dominant_driver: Cross-asset deleveraging triggered by precious-metals crash (margin mechanics/forced unwinds) with Fed leadership uncertainty as volatility amplifier

rates.what_priced: High sensitivity to incoming US cyclical/inflation signals (ISM today; labor later this week). Base case still leans toward a reactive front-end that can reprice quickly on inflation vs growth balance (inference).
rates.underpriced_risk: Policy credibility/independence premium: even if near-term rate path is unchanged, uncertainty about future reaction function can keep term premium and real-rate volatility elevated, pressuring equity multiples (inference).

equities.what_priced: Risk is being marked through liquidation/vol channels rather than fundamentals; tech/duration factor likely carrying more beta to real-rate moves and de-grossing (Reuters, AP; inference).
equities.underpriced_risk: Second-round effects from commodity/crypto drawdowns into systematic strategies (vol-control/CTA) and prime-broker risk limits if metals/crypto remain disorderly (MarketWatch; inference).

gold.what_priced: Near-term price action dominated by unwind/liquidity/margin effects rather than macro inflation hedge demand (Reuters).
gold.underpriced_risk: If Fed-independence concern re-intensifies (or geopolitical tail re-widens), safe-haven demand can reappear quickly once forced selling abates, creating two-way gap risk (AP; inference).

fx_usd.what_priced: USD dynamics appear tied to shifting Fed narrative and risk-off deleveraging rather than clean growth differentials (MarketWatch; inference).
fx_usd.underpriced_risk: USD squeeze risk if liquidation intensifies and hedging demand rises, tightening financial conditions for risk assets (inference).

energy.what_priced: Near-term easing in disruption premium on Iran-related headlines; reduces immediate inflation impulse (AP, Washington Post).
energy.underpriced_risk: Geopolitical premium can reprice abruptly; any reversal would hit inflation expectations/real yields and complicate equity risk (inference).

risk_register.risk: Deleveraging spillover: precious-metals margin/forced liquidation propagates into equities/credit/FX via VAR shocks and de-grossing
Fed reaction-function/independence uncertainty (Warsh nomination narrative) sustains elevated real-rate vol and compresses equity duration multiples
risk_register.timeframe: This week into coming months (confirmation/transition headlines)

risk_register.risk: Data whipsaw: ISM (incl. prices paid) and subsequent labor prints drive rapid rotation between growth-scare and sticky-inflation regimes
risk_register.timeframe: Today through Thu (Feb 5 claims) and into next major inflation print

risk_register.risk: Commodity complex instability: continued disorderly moves in gold/silver and miners amplify risk via liquidity and sentiment channels
Policy/China response risk: strategic minerals stockpile rhetoric triggers retaliation/export controls or supply-chain repricing beyond niche names

event_warnings: Feb 2 2026 15:00 UTC: ISM Manufacturing PMI + ISM Prices — key for rates/real-yield impulse and equity-duration factor rotation.
Feb 2 2026 17:30 UTC: Fed speaker (Bostic) — any commentary on inflation tolerance/financial stability could interact with liquidation-sensitive tape.
Feb 3 2026 15:00 UTC: JOLTS — labor tightness read can swing front-end pricing and risk sentiment.
Feb 4 2026 13:15 UTC: ADP Employment; Feb 4 15:00 UTC: ISM Services — higher beta to policy-path repricing than Europe PMIs.
Watch for exchange/clearing announcements (additional margin changes) as a non-linear liquidity catalyst for metals and correlated risk assets (Reuters context).
